text.__SUMMARY__: Conus antoniaensis is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusc in the family Conidae, the cone snails, cone shells or cones.These snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans.
text.Description: The size of the shell varies between 11 mm and 30 mm.
text.Distribution: This species occurs in the Atlantic Ocean off Boa Vista Island, Cape Verde.
text.References: Cossignani T. & Fiadeiro R. (2014). Quattro nuovi coni da Capo Verde. Malacologia Mostra Mondiale. 83: 14-19.
